title.narrative: 2.4 DISTRICT Early Child Development (ECD) SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, young children (up to 5 years), especially the most vulnerable, have increased access to holistic developmental opportunities for improved school readiness, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, in selected areas (the most disadvantaged districts and municipalities), social sector systems are providing integrated, quality services to fulfil the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents and women with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, young children (up to 5 years), especially the most vulnerable, have increasedaccess to holistic developmental opportunities for improved school readiness

description.narrative: Parental education proved to be effective, with the evidence that 11,593 (73.3 per cent) caregivers have attended more than 50 per cent of the 20 sessions 20 provided. Furthermore, there are changes in desirable direction for knowledge (81.3 per cent), attitude (23.3 per cent) and practice (60 per cent). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: of District Development Committees (DDC) with an annual multi-sectoral, gender-sensitive ECD plan (incorporating stimulation, education, health, HIV and AIDS, nutrition, protection and WASH interventions tapping local resources linking with CFLG)
% of girls and boys with ECD experience enrolled in Grade 1 in 15 priority districts

baseline.value: 50 per cent girls, 50 per cent boys (15 districts)

target.value: 2017:70 per cent for both girls and boys

actual.value: 2017:There has been significant increase in the Grade 1 with ECD experience in priority districts. Girls = 67.3 per cent, Boys = 70 per cent, Total = 68.6 per cent. This is above national average of Girls = 64.3 per cent, Boys = 65 per cent, Total = 64.7 per cent

title.narrative: % of ECD centres in priority districts applying the six learning corners (library/book, story, mathematics, drama, creative science and building blocks) as prescribed in DOE

target.value: 2017:50 per cent in first 10 convergence districts

actual.value: 2017:Endline data gathering of the 500 ECD centers in 5 districts just started.
